description: Alterations to front entrance and erection of new poster box on Albert Street, erection of a 2 storey extension and removal existing open fire escape and replacement with an enclosed fire escape to the south west elevation of No. 79 Parkway for the Jewish Museum (Class D1).
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until:a)	The applicant has submitted a programme of ground investigation for the presence of soil and groundwater contamination and landfill gas for approval by the Council; andb) The investigation has been carried out in accordance with the approved details and the results and remediation measures (if necessary) have been submitted to and approved by the Council. All approved remediation measures shall be implemented strictly in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To protect future occupiers of the development from the possible presence of ground contamination arising in connection with the previous industrial/storage use of the site in accordance with policy SD10B of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 3 - Noise levels at a point 1 metre external to sensitive facades shall be at least 5dB(A) less than the existing background measurement (LA90), expressed in dB(A) when all plant/equipment are in operation unless the plant/equipment hereby permitted will have a noise that has a distinguishable, discrete continuous note (whine, hiss, screech, hum) and/or if there are distinct impulses (bangs, clicks, clatters, thumps), then the noise levels from that piece of plant/equipment at any sensitive fa�ade shall be at least 10dB(A) below the LA90, expressed in dB(A).


Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbouring premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies SD6, SD7B, SD8 and Appendix 1of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 4 - Where it is anticipated that any plant/equipment will have a noise that has a distinguishable, discrete continuous note (whine, hiss, screech, hum) and/or if there are distinct impulses (bangs, clicks, clatters, thumps) special attention should be given to reducing the noise levels from that piece of plant/equipment at any sensitive fa�ade to at least 10dB(A) below the LA90, expressed in dB(A).


Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbouring premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies SD6, SD7B, SD8 and Appendix 1of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 5 - For each of the octave band of centre frequencies 63Hz-8KHz inclusive, noise levels from all plant/equipment (measured in LAeq) when in operation shall at all times add not more than 1 decibel to the existing background noise level LA90, expressed in dB(A), in the same octave band as measured 1 metre external to sensitive facades.


Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbouring premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies SD6, SD7B, SD8 and Appendix 1of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding the approved plans, the materials enclosing the proposed external fire escape on the south west elevation of 79 Parkway are not approved and revised drawings of an acceptable fire escape shall be submitted for approval in writing prior to the development first commencing on site. Once approved the fire escape enclosures shall be retained and maintained at all times.  

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies B1 and B7 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 7 - Notwithstanding the approved plan JM (05) 02 P, a revised drawing of the proposed north west elevation of 79 Parkway showing some form visual interest to the approved timber cladding shall be submitted for approval in writing before the development first occupied. Once approved the elevation shall be retained and maintained at all times.  

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies  B1 and B7 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
Condition : 8 - Notwithstanding the approved plans, the proposed open jointed green oak timber batten wall cladding shall be treated to prevent its natural weathering.


Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies B1 and B7 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006. 
Condition : 9 - Details of the design, materials and fixing of the blast proof secondary glazing shall be submitted for approval in writing before the development is first occupied. Once approved the glazing shall be retained and maintained at all times.  

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies  B1, B6 and B7 of the London Borough of Camden Replacement Unitary Development Plan 2006.
ward: Camden Town with Primrose Hill (Pre May 2022)
